caption: Ex Ippudo President! Mr Kanegae! one the best ramen shop in NYC! You’ll be surprised with his passion of Creation! Gotta try it! Gotta have it! Not only Ramen noodles but many fusion dishes are outstanding!
There are excellent ramen spots in the NY area and this isn’t one. Every element of the Tonkotsu Ramen was disappointing. Only the service was good.
Awesome spot to have something when in a rush. Their service is prompt, pricing is affordable, good vibes. I highly recommend this spot.
Lunch here is great! They have unique starter plates and genuine Japanese food. The service is the best I've seen in this area.

somehow they went super cheap, 2 small pieces of dried porc with soso noodles and not topings at all. There was no egg and a little amount of noodles. Great service but there are much better places around with more stuff on the dish and for less $
I really like this spot, great hospitality and Asahi full draft is a blessing. Please work on your chasu, it’s always dry. Otherwise I love the food and drink

We eat a lot of Japanese ramen, and this is the place we frequent most. This is not your run-of-the-mill ramen shop. The flavors are inspired by Italian cuisine (expect porcini-based broth packed with umami flavors), and the composition is both creative and delicious. None of the broths are overly rich or salty, and the noodles are bouncy and chewy. Subtly addictive, we find ourselves going back again and again and again...

Very interesting dishes. More on the contemporary and experimental side of flavors. Less traditional. Good to try once or twice. Nice cozy backyard patio. Great service.  Table for 2. We ordered the ribs and the unagi (eel) sushi as appetizers, both were enough to share. The ribs were falling off the bone. It was savory bbq-like sauce and was coated in nuts. The eel sushi was disappointing. It tasted like packaged eel and the sushi rice was just falling apart.  For ramen, we ordered the point blank and shoyu ramen. You can add a $3 egg (!!!). The point blank was a disappointment. The horseradish was so overwhelming you really can't taste anything else. If you enjoy eating mouthfuls of wasabi, then coughing, then this is for you. The shoyu ramen was much more traditional and was the better choice. You can really taste the umami from the fish base broth and bonito. The broth was light but flavorful and hearty. It really hit the spot on the winter afternoon. Both came with charsui, however, of the pork loin variety, not the pork belly kind. So it was dry and didn't have much flavorful.  Overall great service. Interesting and "fun" flavors.  My only complaint is that I wish they had a choice between hot tea or ice cold water. We're out in the patio in the cold and there was no choice of hot tea? Hmm.

美味しかった! Heavenly delicious ramen, normally I don't stray from tradition when it comes to Tonkotsu but their version is inventive and delicious to the last drop. Their patio is cozy but really well divided and ventilated. I felt safe and comfortable. Also the aged iichiko shochu was a real treat.

My favorite Ramen in BK. The mushrooms and menma taste caramelized. Awesome service!  OK a quick update: It is a shame that this place opened shortly before the start of the pandemic, because it seems to be flying under the radar. I cannot stress this enough: it is the best ramen available in Brooklyn. Managing to be rich and flavorful without being overwhelming.  The secret is in their dashi and tare, I don't know how they do it... My only recommendation is that you  might want a little more chashu then they provide on default so be sure to ask for extra.

celebrated a birthday w my housemates here. everything was top notch and we had the heated backyard to ourselves. the kind and attentive service, price and vegan selections are impeccable. we also enjoyed the asahi with yuzu, matcha slushies and hot sake. everything was flavorful and delicious and paired well together. thank you so much!
Amaaazing ramen!  The best Japanese comfort food you can find.
Best ramen in Brooklyn. Food and spice was on point and the waitstaff went above and beyond.  Def worth checking out!
Sweetest staff I have ever seen! Lots of vegetarian options.
GREAT from a regular Tonkatsu lover. First Ramen since lockdown (take out is not the same). Proud this was my first one back
The flavors were so rich and delicious.   The staff was very kind and thankful.   Happy to have something like this so close to me.   Keep up the great work!

Terrific Japanese place in Brooklyn!! Really unique flavors. We got the knuckle head one-off spicy tonkotsu ramen, the spare ribs, and the fish and chips but with the fish in a sandwich with bomboloni “patty”. We also got the shaken peach jelly drink (it’s got a bit of alcohol but it’s like liquid sweet peach jelly... one of my favs!). Everything was soooo good! The spare ribs had a unique party mix kind of flavor... the meat was falling off the bones and so tender. The ramen had a tangy flavor but rich at the same time. The fish and chips sandwich is like an upscale version of Fillet o fish that I loved and the fries that come with it have a good crunch! Highly recommend.
Everything is just perfect! I'm so glad this place exists!
(Translated by Google) Excellent service  (Original) Excelente servicio
Great back patio. Ramen was spectacular. Highly recommend
Interesting take on ramen. Worth the trip from Manhattan. Not quite the best in the city but still very good. The broth was tasty and not greasy.

Just got the Spicy Vegetarian Ramen delivered via Caviar and it was HOT and SO FREAKING GOOD! Very clever packaging, a brief and interesting menu, great add-ons. I don’t usually write reviews but WOW this place inspires me. Thank you.
Superb ramen with a savory broth. Noodles are perfect silky/chewy. Will be back!
excellent ramen. Clean flavors
new Japanese ramen spot started by Ex Ippudo. Had the spicy Captain Brooklyn ramen and the broth was delicious. Nice addition to the area for some good slurping!
Highly recommend the Chef Special Iron Men

I had a very high expectations for this place, since I read about it before the opening. The restaurant atmosphere is good, however the food was not up to the expectation at all. We ordered steam bun and Ramen. The bun didn't look like fresh, and the pork piece inside was very small. The Ramen had Chicken Broth with aged Pork and I'm not a big fan of chicken broth so that might be why the Ramen was meh to me. Probably the best part of the ramen was noodle. I would give it 3 stars.

We stumbled upon this gem headed to East Wind right next door for some dumplings as it was pure cozy Brooklyn style. Marvel shields to protect you from the splash of the broth - what a cool presentation of serving the Ramen, and some of the best Ramen I’ve ever had! I got the Captain Brooklyn and it was amazing! Perfectly spicy. Ambiance a plus. A must go!

I got the vegetarian ramen "Captain Brooklyn". The broth was delicious, not nearly as spicy as advertised. I added chashu (pork), which I didn't like, because it was sightly chewy. It was filling and for a creamy broth, it didn't feel greasy. The staff was friendly and the ambiance is entertaining, with lots of details to look at. The menu could use some work; it's fun to have a whimsical menu, but I and other customers were asking lots of simple questions because many items have vague descriptions.  All in all a good meal, but not worth the unpredictable waits that come with the crowds it drives in. There are other good ramen options nearby (and elsewhere in the city).

Overall a pretty okay spot! Worth the trek from Manhattan? 🤷🏻‍♂️  Tons of appetizers to choose from. Ton of sake to choose from (no hot sake though, bummer). 3 choices of ramen. Wine and whiskey are coming soon.  The bao buns were a little chewy. The edamame was pretty good. Covered in garlic which I was okay with but if you’re not a garlic lover you may want to keep looking.  The captain Brooklyn ramen is a veggie broth (mushroom and seaweed) and supposedly quite spicy though no one seemed to have any issues with the amount of spice. Also comes with the fun shield (you don’t keep the shield) that you use to protect yourself from the splatters of hot oil. Lots of fun marvel Easter eggs around the restaurant.  The chef special, pork broth ramen, was pretty good. The broth itself was a little salty (fine by me but not for all) and very tasty! The broth was the best part of the night!! Comes with a garnish in top and bamboo shoots. You have to order everything else. I do wish I could have added corn. Also, nothing currently for adding spice. Luckily the waitress snagged a bit of spice for us which was great!  Luckily we were in the first group seated. Opens at 5pm...by 5:20 the wait was over an hour. By 5:40 the wait topped 2 hours.  It wasn’t the best I’ve had but certainly better than many (if not most) I’ve tried in NY! I would change the menu to explain what comes in each bowl of ramen, add corn, spice, and hot sake. Otherwise this was a good spot. I probably won’t be making the trek back to Brooklyn for this ramen alone but if you’re in the neighborhood and looking for some good food, you’ll enjoy this new ramen shop!
Great presentation of ramen in it's purest form. The iron-men broth tastes like it's been reduced over 2 days.  Recommend getting the okonomi wa-foo as a starter.

Came here tonight on opening night, busy even at 9p. I expected nothing less in waiting. After I was kindly seated at the counter/bar the food and drinks I ordered arrived quite quickly. The service and hospitality is overall very very good. I tried the oxtail which was very delicious but the high price tag for 1 piece makes me question the worth of it. I then tried the Capt Brooklyn which might've been gimmicky in which they give you a small Capt America shield to protect yourself from the splashing oil that they pour over the bowl of ramen. I did feel a little bit if splash so gimmicky as it may be it does help shield you a bit. As for the point of it, it highly reminded me of the fire ramen I tried in Kyoto where they set your ramen on fire. It brings out a very fragrant smell and I'm sure it adds some flare to it. As for the noodles they were well cooked and the soft egg was perfect. As for the broth, it isn't for the faint of heart, it started off quite tame then as you eat and drink more of it the spiciness level catches up to you very quickly!  Overall food and service makes me highly recommend this place although it is quite expensive but for the area and being in NYC you really can't expect affordability when the restaurants need to pay the high rent. Also I would like to see how this location plays out as I think they may run into the troubles of lines out the door and people taking their time eating which might affect their service. I hope this won't be the case.
